Team Fortress Classic, remake del Team Fortress original, con dise√±os y mapas en HD, fue un mod creado originalmente para Quake, y m√°s tarde perfeccionado con el motor Gold Source. Este vio la luz en el a√±o 1999.
El juego ha sido muy revolucionario para su √©poca, ya que fue el primer videojuego multijugador FPS en llevar a cabo varias clases diferentes a elegir para lograr nuestros objetivos. 9 clases de personajes conforman los equipos en cada una de las facciones, estas son: Explorador, Francotirador, Soldado, Explosivos, M√©dico, Infante Pesado, Incendiario, Esp√≠a, e Ingeniero (10 clases diferentes si contamos al Civil en el modo de juego VIP)
Este nos sit√∫a en una guerra entre dos facciones, el "Team Blue" y el "Team Red". Como objetivo principal, tienen que capturar y defender sus banderas, puntos de control, territorios, y escoltar VIP¬¥s. Para ello, posee 4 modos de juego variados, tales como CTF, Control Territorial, Atacar y Defender, y Escolta.
Para lograr desarrollar este t√≠tulo, se necesit√≥ de mucho material referente a Half-Life, el cual podemos observar en mapas y dise√±os de personajes.
Uno de sus puntos malos es que la comunidad de jugadores no se encuentra muy activa en los servidores oficiales. Y uno de sus puntos buenos es que contin√∫an actualizando el juego a la fecha arreglando viejos bugs.
Un juego genial, revolucionario para su √©poca, y con mucha diversidad de personajes para armar estrategias, forman al Team Fortress Classic en un buen t√≠tulo multijugador siempre presente, al nivel de un Counter Strike 1.6, y sin nada que envidiarle al Team Fortress 2.
Recomendado conseguirlo en rebajas en el pack de Valve, ya que est√° pr√°cticamente regalado.

Team Fortress Classic is a game by Valve (I've been doing so many Valve games this month o.o) and it is probably one of my favorites. It is the reason that one of the best games ever (Team Fortress 2) exists. I REALLY love this one. So it's an online FPS game where you can play as a certain character, they are all the same as in TF2 I believe, I haven't played TF2 for years and since this new laptop only plays older games, there is not even a way to play TF2 at this point, but maybe when I get a harddrive, I'll be able to play it.

Anyway, TFC is just Team Fortress 2 with better maps, older graphics, different character design (while still having the same names), and the voice is also completely different. The one in Team Fortress 2 is a female and in this one, it is the normal (kind of creepy) voice that tells you when the round will be over or something simple like that. The sound design is amazing, it is a big improvement for all the previous games by Valve, CS did have some good sound design except the voices sounded like they were talking while a fan was on.

The other things I liked about this game is the character design. Exactly what you'd expect from a Valve game, but with more detail. The characters have personalities in TF2, here it is just Counter-Strike pretty much. But yeah the character design slightly gives off how they might be if they were an actual person. I guess you could say it gives off their personality? I don't really know how to say that one but, yeah, Team Fortress Classic has amazing character design!

The controls are every other Valve game, as I've said about 2000 times at this point, I've review the entire Half-Life 1 Anthology, Counter-Strike Anthology, and some other Valve games that nobody really talks about anymore. But Team Fortress still holds up and has many nice players that I've met in the game. I've played enough of it to really get good at the game and get to know the community of people there that were actually really cool people. Since TFC is an old game, it is kind of dead, but if you wait around a bit, more people start joining the servers.

But another thing I am glad about, this was actually a game from the 90s so it wasn't stupid like every other god damn game by Valve (other than Half-Life series, Counter-Strike, and I guess Ricochet...?) so I'm glad about that. The fun I've had in this game was so much fun. I really recommend this game, it goes for 99 cents during sales but full price it goes for $4.99 USD, so it is a pretty cheap game and I recommend buying it if you're into these old games, so yeah, go for it, definitely, I say do it quick because the game might die. It's still pretty active today and I'm super surprised. In 10 or 20 years, Steam might be gone or something or the game may have 0 players on every server. Many Steam games that are multiplayer might have 0 players, unless they are new, so I recommend you to buy this one quick before anything sad like that happens. Anyway, lets get to the final score.

Final score: 100%

I'm dead serious about the final score. I really am serious. It is pure fun, I REALLY recommend this, I really really REALLY recommend it. It is that good, and I hope you think of buying this sometime soon and I'll meet you there. It is such a good game, a classic. It was out a long time before I even existed but it's still a pretty damn good game. But yes as I've stated millions of times by now, I recommend it. Really. I really really really really really REALLY REALLY recommend it. Bye now, and hope you consider buying this amazing title.

ok, so i got the half life bundle roughly 2 years ago, and TFC just so happened to come with it. I found myself more and more attached to this game and i gotta say i LOVE it. I haven't played as long as the regulars have (like 20 years or so) but i fit right in with them. 

to the new player who wants to play this game, heres some words from me...
-set your username in the multiplayer options, so you aren't "Player."
-dont let the really good snipers/soldiers discourage you.
-don't go into resupply if you're infected. that shit spreads. either killbind or get a medic to heal you.
-don't take all 3 bags in 2fort. leave 1 or 2 for the rest of the team.
-ask for game help if you need it. remember, we were all "Player" at some point.

This game has many good and bad aspects. Here's a quick list:

The Good:
> The game is really fun with a handful of people
> There are a ton of maps (This is both an upside and a downside, mostly due to new players not knowing what to do in some game-modes)
> The classes (Scout, Soldier, Pyro, Demo-man, Heavy Weapons Guy, Engineer, Sniper, Medic, & Spy) are very fun to play as.

The Bad:
>Some classes, such as Pyro and Medic, are very overpowered. (Pyro has a rocket launcher that sets the enemy on fire, and Medic has two shotguns.)
>There are very little people who still play this game, all in 3 servers.
Overall I give this game a 9.5/10. There just isn't much wrong with the game, or I didn't pick some of the flaws.

es un excelente juego,tiene sus problemas si como el abuso de las granadas,la falta de servidores en sudamerica pero por lo demas es excelente valga la redundancia porque es como la version FAST de half life y counter strike,es muy divertido el modo  de contorl points y mi mapa favorito es "warpath"

si piensas comprar este juego date tu tiempo para que este te empiece a gustar, despues de un tiempo corto si aprendes a jugarlo en un nivel medio creeme que no lo dejaras de jugar, es muy adictivo y dinamico , no te dejes guiar por el hecho de que es un juego viejo, o de que tf2 es gratuito, gracias a esa mentalidad pobre el juego esta muriendo y es injusto, porque muchos no se dan el tiempo de entender y aprender a jugarlo,  y si, habra 2 o 3 servidores  con gente pero cuando entres en ellos te vas a contagiar  de las ganas de pasarte un tiempo largo jugandolo, ayuda a que este juego no siga cayendo en el olvido.

The predecessor to Valve's acclaimed Source Engine title [i]Team Fortress 2[/i], Team Fortress Classic is well...classic.

Chaotic gameplay between the famous Blue and Red teams in enclosed area fighting for flags and dominance. Choose a class and head straight into an explosive filled battle, that would make even renouned film director Micheal Bay jealous. 

Having PLayed TF2 I see the similarty in gameplay, despite the age and engine difference beteween the two games. Neither really interest me to an extent but I respect what they hold in value. Read other reviews by players, many have thousands upon thousands of hours of playtime into this game and hold it to high value. I myself fail to the allue that seems to hypnotize some but I still see the allure. 

I would probably have more playtime under my belt if it weren't for the lack of a solid playerbase, unlike games such as Day of Defeat or the Half Life Mod Sven Co-op, Team Fortress Classic doesn't have a large playerbase. I have yet to see a complety filled server. Upon playing an active server, you are gretted by players who probably have more playtime into this game than the total lifetime of most TF2 players. Some of the players I have encountered were toxic while some were not, however, everone had their minds set on the objectives-thus making the game a dynamic race to kill everyone else before they vaporize you in a wave of explosive fury.

I don't know much about custom maps or servers in this game due to the low playercount but I assume there is much to behold. 

I recommend getting this game on sale, $5 USD is asking too much for a game that might not even have 50 people onlne at a given time. Despite that I hope Team Fortress Classic flourishes well in the future. This game has captivated the hearts and minds of many players, even if most have migrated to TF2. I might not enjoy the game very much but I do recommend to anyone that enjoys fast/explosive paced team gameplay.
